title: convex optimization - What is the relation between different generalizations of linear programming?
body: Linear programming subsumed by each of Semidefinite programming (SDP) Convex programming (CXP) SOS programming (SSP) Is there any relation between each pair in the three? Are all three equivalent in expressive capability? convex-optimization linear-programming sums-of-squares semidefinite-programming Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jul 15, 2020 at 18:37 none 1,137 1 1 gold badge 10 10 silver badges 24 24 bronze badges asked Jul 14, 2020 at 23:36 VS. 1,846 1 1 gold badge 12 12 silver badges 27 27 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 1 $\begingroup$ $LP\subset SDP\subset SSP\subset CXP$. Also, you can encode SSP as SDP by lifting. These slides are relevant: mit.edu/~parrilo/pubs/talkfiles/Eckman.pdf $\endgroup$ Dustin G. Mixon –  Dustin G. Mixon 2020-07-15 01:32:28 +00:00 Commented Jul 15, 2020 at 1:32 $\begingroup$ So it is rather $LP\subset_{poly} SDP=_{poly}SSP\subset_{poly} CXP$? By subscript $poly$ I mean you are blowing up the program only polynomially. So the inclusions are upto polynomial blowup? $\endgroup$ VS. –  VS. 2020-07-15 01:33:29 +00:00 Commented Jul 15, 2020 at 1:33 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
